definition: worth it/it pays to
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: A 70-fold increase in speed for a sevenfold increase in price would seem a bargain.
sentences.chinese: 速度增加70倍，价格才涨了7倍，似乎很划得来。

sentences.english: These toys are areal bargain at such low prices.
sentences.chinese: 这些玩具的代价这么便宜，真划得来。

sentences.english: Was it worthwhile opening a shoe-store?
Fracking might still be worth doing given those costs.
sentences.chinese: 尽管需要消纳这些成本，水力压裂仍然是划得来做的。

sentences.english: They doubted whether all this work would pay off.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑这样干是否划得来。

sentences.english: It pays to buy goods owing to their superior quality.
sentences.chinese: 买高质量的货京东取消订单物是划得来的。

definition: worthwhile/to be a good deal/to be a bargain/to reckon up/to calculate
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
not worth it
not worth
profit (colloquial)
tangible benefit/material advantages/cheap/economical/advantageous (deal)/substantial (discount)
convenient
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your
to have money left/remaining money
to break even/to get one's money's worth
loss/to sustain losses
to make a loss
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
to overcharge/to rip sb off
whether it's right or wrong doesn't make a lot of difference/six of one and half a dozen of the other/as broad as it is long
